title: [K-12] Education Utilizing CSCL Interaction Monitoring and Assessment Design Patterns

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) environments and language teaching experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing monitoring and evaluation competencies using CSCL interaction data in smartphone-based limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods to classify learning interactions in CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) environments using quantitative/qualitative metrics.
Learners can design three or more CSCL interaction monitoring systems utilizing design patterns (DPs).
Learners can perform interaction evaluations by applying smartphone-based data tracking methods in limited-technology environments.
Learners can submit deliverables applying DP solutions to real CSCL scenarios through project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
